titles.title: Recognizing and congratulating the East Boynton Beach, Florida, Little League team as the 2003 United States Little League Champions.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil Service and Agency Organization.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Subcommittee on Civil Service and Agency Organization Discharged.
Mr. LaTourette moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 273.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 1/21/2004--Passed Senate without amendment. Recognizes the Little League team East Boynton Beach, Florida, for winning the United States Little League Championship. Invites the players, coaches, parents, and other league and city officials to the Capitol to be honored and requests that the President recognize the team.
